bibl.title: Chin Hing v. United States of America. Memorandum
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: In re Appeal, case of Chin Hing, alleged minor son of merchant.

Memorandum for the Acting Secretary: After carefully considering the evidence presented in this record, the Bureau concurs in the excluding decidion rendered by the Commissioner at Seattle on the ground that the relationship claimed has not been shown to exist. It also believes that applicant should be denied because the mercantile status of the alleged father is not reasonably established.
It is recommended that the exclusion of applicant be ordered and his deportation directed.
Note: Local counsel, Corry M. Stadden, Esq., requests an opportunity to present an oral argument.
